ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Hereditary Sensorineural Hearing Loss
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Bilateral sloping sensorineural hearing loss with a strong family history (mother, aunt, sibling, son) and no history of noise exposure, ear pathology, or rapid progression.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess hearing sensitivity and configuration of hearing loss.
To evaluate speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates a bilateral, sloping sensorineural hearing loss, with normal low-frequency hearing sloping to mild-to-moderate loss in the high frequencies. Speech audiometry is consistent with pure-tone findings, showing excellent word recognition. Tympanometry reveals normal middle ear function bilaterally.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Bilateral sloping SNHL. Right ear: normal 250-1000 Hz, sloping to moderate 3000-6000 Hz. Left ear: normal 250-1000 Hz, sloping to mild/moderate high frequencies. PTA: RE 18 dB HL, LE 18 dB HL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRTs (RE 20 dB HL, LE 15 dB HL) agree with PTAs. WRS is excellent (RE 96%, LE 100% at 60 dB HL).

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Normal Type A tympanograms bilaterally. Static admittance: RE 1.00 mL, LE 1.40 mL.

proposed_items: Evaluation for Hearing Assistive Technology (HAT) options
Use of hearing protection in noisy environments
counseling_actions: Counseling on the hereditary nature and configuration of the hearing loss

escalation.rationale_short: Medical clearance for amplification (noted as completed in case history).
